title: Barney the Purple Dinosaur live-action film helmed by Daniel Kaluuya in the works
text:
Barney the Purple Dinosaur is set to appear on the big screen with his own movie.

The iconic dinosaur first appeared on TV screens in 1992 with the children's series Barney & Friends, which ran for 13 seasons.

And on Friday, it was announced that Barney is off to Hollywood for his big break after Mattel Films added the friendly dinosaur to the list of other family favourite projects - including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Masters of the Universe, American Girl and Magic 8 Ball.

The live-action film will mark the first collaboration of Mattel Films, Valparaiso Pictures and Daniel Kaluuya's 59 percent production company.

'I love you, you love me': Barney the Purple Dinosaur is set to appear on the big screen with his own movie. The character first appeared on TV screens in 1992 with the children's series Barney & Friends, which ran for 13 seasons

Get Out star Daniel said in a statement: 'Barney was a ubiquitous figure in many of our childhoods, then he disappeared into the shadows, left misunderstood.

Get out! The live-action film will mark the first collaboration between Daniel Kaluuya's 59 percent production company, Mattel Films and Valparaiso Pictures

'We're excited to explore this compelling modern-day hero and see if his message of 'I love you, you love me' can stand the test of time.'

And Robbie Brenner of Mattel Films added: 'Working with Daniel Kaluuya will enable us to take a completely new approach to Barney that will surprise audience and subvert expectations.

'The project will speak to the nostalgia of the brand in a way that will resonate with adults, while entertaining today's kids.'

The original TV show made way for some of today's stars, including Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato, who both appeared on the programme before starting careers with Disney.

The Good for You star recently admitted to having an 'awkward' crush on the man dressed in the Barney suit.

She said: 'The guy in the suit was kind of attractive. At that time you are young, you're seven and you are like 'What are these things that I'm feeling, he is so attractive.'

'It was great. I enjoyed it. It's what sparked me on to doing all of this.'

However, the singer pointed out that there has been several people operating Barney's suit throughout the show's 21-year run.
